content: Right now — not all time, but just from players in the league *now* — who would you rather have: Kawhi, Durant, Curry, Westbrook, Harden, or LeBron, with the knowledge that choosing LeBron the player also means you have LeBron the GM, who *sucks.* That’s maybe unfair because MJ wasn’t a great GM by any means. It’s kind of holding LeBron accountable for the era in which he played.But if we throw that out, then we have to appreciate that MJ would’ve been so much more durable had he played now, and that — plus recency bias — is the reason we’re even discussing this in the first place.
